content.question: If <math alttext="h of x, equals, the integral from, negative pi over 4, to the sine squared of x, of, the cosecant of, open parenthesis, t to the fourth power, plus 1, close parenthesis, d t " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mi>h</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>x</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>csc</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> for <math alttext="negative pi over 4, less than or equal to x, less than or equal to, pi over 4 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>, then <math alttext="h prime of x, equals " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 6.4: The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus and Accumulation Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
